channel.title: VPS Help Please
channel.description:
I need some help, I have everything set up no-ip, java, my source, ect. But i have no clue on how to portforward the vps. I tried using uTorrent but it doesn't work for some reason.
[IMG]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/4816/46a99ff397454aebb69365f.png[/img]

item.title: VPS Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Taharahora Taharahora
item.description:
@Taharahora wrote:

PavSwag:

I need some help, I have everything set up no-ip, java, my source, ect. But i have no clue on how to portforward the vps. I tried using uTorrent but it doesn’t work for some reason.

It is internet explorer security and the firewall. simply disable the firewall and in internet explorer options set it to allow everything and disable the security features. (I have used a VPS 3 times so far, so get how it works.)

canyouseeme.org never said it could see me. but the server got up just fine. and for runelocus to see it you have to have the client connected

Read full topic

item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

OMG in a vps all the ports are already open just disable fire put ip in client java or whatever compile make a jar and webclient and you just made your own rsps

item.title: VPS Help Please
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“PavSwag, post:5, topic:461475”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=564416.msg4109231#msg4109231 date=1348362464]
Mostly all VPS providers have all ports un-blocked/already forwarded on their servers, try fixing any server related problems. Servers, especially from VPS providers don’t require port-forwarding. And also, what exactly is your picture showing us?
[/quote]

Its showing its connected to an internet network, And this one shows, its not open. [/quote]

Try disabling firewall or adding an exception in the firewall for port 43594. With a VPS all ports are unblocked and/or port-forwarded already, the only thing blocking them could be System Services using the ports already, or firewall. So just disable the firewall and let me know your results.

Read full topic
